form.longName: PhenX PX090901 - Personal And Family History Of Respiratory Symptoms Dise
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol obtains information about the personal history of respiratory symptoms and illnesses. Duration of disease, other allergic diseases, occupational history, smoking status, and family history of selected respiratory diseases are also assessed. Supplemental questions were added from other studies in areas judged to be inadequately covered by this questionnaire.

headerInstruction.text: SYMPTOMS: These questions pertain mainly to your chest. Please answer yes or no, if possible. If a question does not appear to be applicable to you, check the "Does Not Apply" space. If you are in doubt about whether your answer is yes or no, record no.

module.longName: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Adult Protocol
module.preferredDefinition: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Adult Protocol

question.questionText: COUGH Do you usually have a cough? (Count a cough with first smoke or on first going outofdoors. Exclude clearing of throat.) (cough_history)
COUGH Do you usually cough as much as 4 to 6 times a day, 4 or more days out of the week? (cough_frequently)
COUGH Do you usually cough at all on getting up, or first thing in the morning? (cough_in_morning)
COUGH Do you usually cough at all during the rest of the day or at night? (cough_day_night)
COUGH Do you usually cough like this on most days for 3 consecutive months or more during the year? (cough_consecutive_months)
COUGH For how many years have you had this cough? (cough_years)
COUGH For how many years have you had this cough? (cough_years_coded)
PHLEGM Do you usually bring up phlegm from your chest? (Count phlegm with the first smoke or on first going outofdoors. Exclude phlegm from the nose. Count swallowed phlegm.) (phlegm_history)
PHLEGM Do you usually bring up phlegm like this as much as twice a day, 4 or more days out of the week? (phlegm_frequently)
PHLEGM Do you usually bring up phlegm at all on getting up or first thing in the morning? (phlegm_in_morning)
PHLEGM Do you usually bring up phlegm at all during the rest of the day or at night? (phlegm_day_night)
PHLEGM Do you bring up phlegm like this on most days for 3 consecutive months or more during the year? (phlegm_consecutive_months)
PHLEGM For how many years have you had trouble with phlegm? (phlegm_years)
PHLEGM For how many years have you had trouble with phlegm? (phlegm_years_coded)

EPISODES OF COUGH AND PHLEGM Have you had periods or episodes of (increased*) cough and phlegm lasting for 3 weeks or more each year? (*For individuals who usually have cough and/or phlegm) (cough_phlegm_period_episode)
EPISODES OF COUGH AND PHLEGM For how long have you had at least 1 such episode per year? (cough_phlegm_episode_lasting_time)
EPISODES OF COUGH AND PHLEGM For how long have you had at least 1 such episode per year? (cough_phlegm_episode_lasting_time_coded)
WHEEZING Does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: When you have a cold? (wheezing_have_cold)
WHEEZING Does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: Occasionally apart from colds? (wheezing_apart_from_cold)
WHEEZING Does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: Most days or nights? (wheezing_day_night)
WHEEZING For how many years has this been present? (wheezing_years)
WHEEZING For how many years has this been present? (wheezing_years_coded)
WHEEZING Have you ever had an ATTACK of wheezing that has made you feel short of breath? (wheezing_attack_ever)
WHEEZING How old were you when you had your first such attack? (wheezing_first_age)
WHEEZING How old were you when you had your first such attack? (wheezing_first_age_coded)
WHEEZING Have you had 2 or more such episodes? (wheezing_attack_multiple_episodes)
WHEEZING Have you ever required medicine or treatment for the(se) attack(s)? (wheezing_attack_medicine_treatment_ever)
BREATHLESSNESS If disabled from walking by any condition other than heart or lung disease, please describe Nature of condition(s): (breathlessness_condition_nature)
If disabled from walking by any condition other than heart or lung disease, please describe and proceed to CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES Questions. (inst2_090901)
BREATHLESSNESS Are you troubled by shortness of breath when hurrying on the level or walking up a slight hill? (breathlessness_hurrying_slight_hill)
BREATHLESSNESS Do you have to walk slower than people of your age on the level because of breathlessness? (breathlessness_need_walk_slower)
BREATHLESSNESS Do you ever have to stop for breath when walking at your own pace on the level? (breathlessness_need_stop_own_pace)
BREATHLESSNESS Do you ever have to stop for breath after walking about 100 yards (or after a few minutes) on the level? (breathlessness_need_stop_100_yards)
BREATHLESSNESS Are you too breathless to leave the house or breathless on dressing or undressing? (breathlessness_leave_house_dressing_undressing)
CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES If you get a cold, does it usually go to your chest? (Usually means more than 1/2 the time.) (cold_usually_go_to_chest)
CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES During the past 3 years, have you had any chest illnesses that have kept you off work, indoors at home, or in bed? (chest_illness_keep_home_bed)
CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES Did you produce phlegm with any of these chest illnesses? (chest_illness_phlegm)
CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES In the last 3 years, how many such illnesses, with (increased) phlegm, did you have which lasted a week or more? Number of illnesses: (chest_illness_phlegm_number)
CHEST COLDS AND CHEST ILLNESSES In the last 3 years, how many such illnesses, with (increased) phlegm, did you have which lasted a week or more? (chest_illness_phlegm_lasting_week)
PAST ILLNESSES Lung Trouble Did you have any lung trouble before the age of 16? (lung_trouble_before_age_16)
PAST ILLNESSES Bronchitis Have you ever had Attacks of bronchitis? (bronchitis_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Bronchitis Was it confirmed by a doctor? (bronchitis_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Bronchitis At what age was your first attack? (bronchitis_first_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Bronchitis At what age was your first attack? (bronchitis_first_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Pneumonia Have you ever had Pneumonia (include bronchopneumonia)? (pneumonia_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Pneumonia Was it confirmed by a doctor? (pneumonia_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Pneumonia At what age did you first have it? (pneumonia_first_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Pneumonia At what age did you first have it? (pneumonia_first_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Hay fever Have you ever had Hay fever? (hay_fever_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Hay fever Was it confirmed by a doctor? (hay_fever_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Hay fever At what age did it start? (hay_fever_start_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Hay fever At what age did it start? (hay_fever_start_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Chronic Bronchitis Have you ever had chronic bronchitis? (chronic_bronchitis_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Chronic Bronchitis Do you still have it? (chronic_bronchitis_still_have)
PAST ILLNESSES Chronic Bronchitis Was it confirmed by a doctor? (chronic_bronchitis_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Chronic Bronchitis At what age did it start? (chronic_bronchitis_start_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Chronic Bronchitis At what age did it start? (chronic_bronchitis_start_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Emphysema Have you ever had emphysema? (emphysema_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Emphysema Do you still have it? (emphysema_still_have)
PAST ILLNESSES Emphysema Was it confirmed by a doctor? (emphysema_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Emphysema At what age did it start? (emphysema_start_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Emphysema At what age did it start? (emphysema_start_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma Have you ever had asthma? (asthma_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma Do you still have it? (asthma_still_have)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma Was it confirmed by a doctor? (asthma_doctor_confirmed)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma At what age did it start? (asthma_start_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma At what age did it start? (asthma_start_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma If you no longer have it, at what age did it stop? (asthma_stop_age)
PAST ILLNESSES Asthma If you no longer have it, at what age did it stop? (asthma_stop_age_coded)
PAST ILLNESSES Other Chest Illnesses Have you ever had Any other chest illnesses? (other_chest_illness_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Other Chest Illnesses Please specify chest illnesses you had. (other_chest_illness_specify)
PAST ILLNESSES Chest Operations Have you ever had Any chest operations? (chest_operation_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Chest Operations Please specify chest operations you had. (chest_operation_specify)
PAST ILLNESSES Chest Injuries Have you ever had Any chest injuries? (chest_injury_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Chest Injuries Please specify chest injuries you had. (chest_injury_specify)
PAST ILLNESSES Heart Trouble Has doctor ever told you that you had heart trouble? (heart_trouble_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES Heart Trouble Have you ever had treatment for heart trouble in the past 10 years? (heart_trouble_treatment_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES High Blood Pressure Has a doctor ever told you that you have high blood pressure? (high_blood_pressure_ever)
PAST ILLNESSES High Blood Pressure Have you had any treatment for high blood pressure (hypertension) in the past 10 years? (high_blood_pressure_treatment_ever)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Have you ever worked full time (30 hours per week or more) for 6 months or more? (full_time_ever)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Dusty Job Have you ever worked for a year or more in any dusty job? (dusty_job_ever)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Dusty Job Specify job/industry: (dusty_job_industry_specify)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Dusty Job Total years worked? (dusty_job_total_years)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Dusty Job Was dust exposure (dusty_job_exposure_degree)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Gas or Chemical Fumes Have you ever been exposed to gas or chemical fumes in your work? (gas_chemical_fumes_exposed_ever)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Gas or Chemical Fumes Specify job/industry: (gas_chemical_fumes_industry_specify)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Gas or Chemical Fumes Total years worked? (gas_chemical_fumes_total_years)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY Gas or Chemical Fumes Was gas or chemical fumes exposure (gas_chemical_fumes_exposure_degree)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY What has been your usual occupation or job the one you have worked at the longest? Joboccupation: (longest_job_occupation)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY What has been your usual occupation or job the one you have worked at the longest? Number of years employed in this occupation: (longest_job_years)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY What has been your usual occupation or job the one you have worked at the longest? Positionjob title: (longest_job_title)
OCCUPATIONAL HISTORY What has been your usual occupation or job the one you have worked at the longest? Business, field, or industry: (longest_job_business_field_industry)
TOBACCO SMOKING Have you ever smoked cigarettes? (NO means less than 20 packs of cigarettes or 12 oz. of tobacco in a lifetime or less than 1 cigarette a day for 1 year.) (smoking_cigarettes_ever)
TOBACCO SMOKING Do you now smoke cigarettes (as of 1 month ago)? (smoking_cigarettes_now)
TOBACCO SMOKING How old were you when you first started regular cigarette smoking? (smoking_cigarettes_start_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING How old were you when you first started regular cigarette smoking? (smoking_cigarettes_start_age_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking cigarettes completely, how old were you when you stopped? Age stopped: (smoking_cigarettes_stop_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking cigarettes completely, how old were you when you stopped? (smoking_cigarettes_stop_age_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING How many cigarettes do you smoke per day now? (smoking_cigarettes_quantity_day_now)
TOBACCO SMOKING How many cigarettes do you smoke per day now? (smoking_cigarettes_quantity_day_now_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING On the average of the entire time you smoked, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day? (smoking_cigarettes_quantity_day_average)
TOBACCO SMOKING On the average of the entire time you smoked, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day? (smoking_cigarettes_quantity_day_average_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING Do or did you inhale the cigarette smoke? (smoking_cigarettes_inhale)
TOBACCO SMOKING Have you ever smoked a pipe regularly? (YES means more than 12 oz. tobacco in a lifetime.) (smoke_pipe_ever)
TOBACCO SMOKING How old were you when you started to smoke a pipe regularly? Age: (smoke_pipe_start_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking a pipe completely, how old were you when you stopped? Age stopped: (smoke_pipe_stop_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking a pipe completely, how old were you when you stopped? (smoke_pipe_stop_age_coded)

TOBACCO SMOKING On the average over the entire time you smoked a pipe, how much pipe tobacco did you smoke per week? Oz. per week (a standard pouch of tobacco contains 1 1/2 oz.): (smoke_pipe_quantity_week_average)

TOBACCO SMOKING On the average over the entire time you smoked a pipe, how much pipe tobacco did you smoke per week? Oz. per week (a standard pouch of tobacco contains 1 1/2 oz.) (smoke_pipe_quantity_week_average_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING How much pipe tobacco are you smoking now? (smoke_pipe_quantity_week_now)
TOBACCO SMOKING How much pipe tobacco are you smoking now? (smoke_pipe_quantity_week_now_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING Do or did you inhale the pipe smoke? (smoke_pipe_inhale)
TOBACCO SMOKING Have you ever smoked cigars regularly? (YES means more than 1 cigar a week for a year.) (smoke_cigars_ever)
TOBACCO SMOKING How old were you when you started smoking cigars regularly? Age: (smoke_cigars_start_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking cigars completely, how old were you when you stopped? Age stopped: (smoke_cigars_stop_age)
TOBACCO SMOKING If you have stopped smoking cigars completely, how old were you when you stopped? (smoke_cigars_stop_age_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING On the average over the entire time you smoked cigars, how many cigars did you smoke per week? (smoke_cigars_quantity_week_average)
TOBACCO SMOKING On the average over the entire time you smoked cigars, how many cigars did you smoke per week? (smoke_cigars_quantity_week_average_coded)
TOBACCO SMOKING How many cigars are you smoking per week now? (smoke_cigars_quantity_week_now)
TOBACCO SMOKING How many cigars are you smoking per week now? (smoke_cigars_quantity_week_now_coded)

validValue.meaningText: Check if not smoking cigars currently
validValue.description: Check if not smoking cigars currently

question.questionText: TOBACCO SMOKING Do or did you inhale the cigar smoke? (smoke_cigars_inhale)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: FATHER Chronic bronchitis? (history_father_chronic_bronchitis)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: FATHER Emphysema? (history_father_emphysema)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: FATHER Asthma? (history_father_asthma)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: FATHER Lung cancer? (history_father_lung_cancer)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: FATHER Other chest conditions? (history_father_other_chest_conditions)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: MOTHER Chronic bronchitis? (history_mother_chronic_bronchitis)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: MOTHER Emphysema? (history_mother_emphysema)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: MOTHER Asthma? (history_mother_asthma)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: MOTHER Lung cancer? (history_mother_lung_cancer)
FAMILY HISTORY Were either of your natural parents ever told by a doctor that they had a chronic lung condition such as: MOTHER Other chest conditions? (history_mother_other_chest_conditions)
Have you ever had wheezing or whistling in your chest? (wheezing_whistling_chest_ever)
About how old were you when you first had wheezing or whistling in your chest? Age in years (Answer 1 if younger than age 1 year): (wheezing_whistling_chest_first_age)
In the last 12 months, have you had wheezing or whistling in your chest at any time? (history_wheezing_whistling_chest)
In the last 12 months, does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: When you have a cold? (history_wheezing_whistling_chest_cold)
In the last 12 months, does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: More than once a week? (history_wheezing_whistling_chest_multiple)
In the last 12 months, does your chest ever sound wheezy or whistling: Most days and nights? (history_wheezing_whistling_chest_day_night)
In the last 12 months, have you been awakened from sleep by coughing, apart from a cough associated with a cold or chest infection? (history_awakened_coughing)
In the last 12 months, have you been awakened from sleep by shortness of breath or a feeling of tightness in your chest? (history_awakened_breath_tightness_chest)
In the past 12 months, have you been bothered by sneezing or a runny or blocked nose when you did not have a cold or the flu? (history_sneezing_runny_blocked_nose)
In the past 12 months, have you been bothered by watery, itchy, or burning eyes when you did not have a cold or the flu? (history_watery_itchy_burning_eyes)

In the past 12 months, have you had periods or episodes of cough with phlegm that lasted 1 week or more? (If you usually have cough and phlegm, please count only periods or episodes of increased cough and phlegm.) (history_cough_phlegm_lasted_week)
For how many years have you had at least one such episode per year? (history_cough_phlegm_years)
About how many such episodes have you had in the past 12 months? (history_cough_phlegm_episodes)
In the past year, have you been to the emergency room or hospitalized for lung problems? (history_er_hospitalized_lung)
How many times? (history_er_hospitalized_lung_times)
In the past year, have you been treated with antibiotics for a chest illness? (history_antibiotics_treatment_chest)
How many times? (history_antibiotics_treatment_chest_times)
In the past year, have you been treated with steroid pills or injections, such as prednisone or solumedrol, for a chest illness? (history_steroid_treatment_chest)
How many times? (history_steroid_treatment_chest_times)

protocol.longName: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Adult Protocol
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol obtains information about the personal history of respiratory symptoms and illnesses. Duration of disease, other allergic diseases, occupational history, smoking status, and family history of selected respiratory diseases are also assessed. Supplemental questions were added from other studies in areas judged to be inadequately covered by this questionnaire.

form.longName: PhenX PX090601 - Exercise Capacity Sixminute Walk Test
form.preferredDefinition: The Six-Minute Walk Test is a timed test that requires minimal technical resources to measure the distance that a patient can quickly walk on a flat, hard surface in a period of 6 minutes (the six-minute walk distance, 6MWD). This measure has been shown to be a reproducible, objective indicator of functional capacity and is a part of the multicomponent BODE index (body-mass index, airflow obstruction, dyspnea, and exercise capacity) that correlates with survival. It is important to emphasize that this is a test of maximum exercise performance; subjects should be instructed and encouraged to push themselves to achieve maximal distance.

headerInstruction.text: See instrument details and worksheets "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/index.php?pageLink=browse.protocoldetails id=90601".

instruction.text: 1. Repeat testing should be performed about the same time of day to minimize intraday variability.2. A "warmup" period before the test should not be performed.3. The patient should sit at rest in a chair, located near the starting position, for at least 10 minutes before the test starts. During this time, check for contraindications, measure pulse and blood pressure, and make sure that clothing and shoes are appropriate. Complete the first portion of the worksheet (see "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/index.php?pageLink=browse.protocoldetails id=90601" under Measurements).

question.questionText: 1. Repeat testing should be performed about the same time of day to minimize intraday variability.2. A "warmup" period before the test should not be performed.3. The patient should sit at rest in a chair, located near the starting position, for at least 10 minutes before the test starts. During this time, check for contraindications, measure pulse and blood pressure, and make sure that clothing and shoes are appropriate. Complete the first portion of the worksheet (see "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/index.php?pageLink=browse.protocoldetails id=90601" Table 1 under Measurements). (instr_mes_090601)
Contraindication (contraindication)
Lap counter (lap_counter)
Blood pressure Systolic (blood_pressure_systolic)
Blood pressure Diastolic (blood_pressure_diastolic)
Medications taken before the test (name) (medications_before_test_name)
Medications taken before the test (dose) (medications_before_test_dose)
Medications taken before the test (time) (medications_before_test_time)
Supplemental oxygen during the test (supplemental_oxygen)
Supplemental oxygen during the test flow (pxt90601_supplemental_oxygen_flow)
Supplemental oxygen during the test type (supplemental_oxygen_type)
Baseline Time (baseline_time)
Baseline Heart Rate (baseline_heart_rate)
Baseline Dyspnea (from the Borg scale) (baseline_dyspnea)
Baseline Fatigue (from the Borg scale) (baseline_fatigue)
Baseline Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) (baseline_spo2)
End of Test Time (end_of_test_time)
End of Test Heart Rate (end_of_test_heart_rate)
End of Test Dyspnea (from Borg scale) (end_of_test_dyspnea)
End of Test Fatigue (from Borg scale) (end_of_test_fatigue)
End of Test Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) (end_of_test_spo2)
Stopped or paused before 6 minutes? (stopped_before_6min)
Reason stopped or paused before 6 minutes (reason_stopped)
Other symptoms at end of exercise (other_symptoms)
Number of laps (number_laps)
Final partial lap distance (final_lap_distance)
Total distance walked in 6 minutes (Number of laps X 60 meters + Final partial lap distance) (total_distance)
Predicted distance (predicted_distance)
Percent predicted (predicted_distance_percent_ee4)
Technicians Comments (tech_comments)
Interpretation (including comparison with a preintervention 6MWD (interpretation)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Six-Minute Walk Test is a timed test that requires minimal technical resources to measure the distance that a patient can quickly walk on a flat, hard surface in a period of 6 minutes (the six-minute walk distance, 6MWD). This measure has been shown to be a reproducible, objective indicator of functional capacity and is a part of the multicomponent BODE index (body-mass index, airflow obstruction, dyspnea, and exercise capacity) that correlates with survival. It is important to emphasize that this is a test of maximum exercise performance; subjects should be instructed and encouraged to push themselves to achieve maximal distance.

form.longName: PhenX PX090902 - Personal And Family History Of Respiratory Sym Child
form.preferredDefinition: Age-specific questions are asked in this protocol to two different age ranges of children. For children ages 13 and 14, a set of questions is asked directly to the child. For children 6 or 7 years old, a set of questions is asked of the parents.

module.longName: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Child Protocol
module.preferredDefinition: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Child Protocol

question.questionText: Have you ever had wheezing or whistling in the chest at any time in the past? (wheezing_whistling_chest_ever_13)
Have you had wheezing or whistling in the chest in the last 12 months? (wheezing_whistling_chest_12_months_13)
How many attacks of wheezing have you had in the last 12 months? (wheezing_attack_times_12_months_13)
In the last 12 months, how often, on average, has your sleep been disturbed due to wheezing? (wheezing_sleep_disturbed_12_months_13)

validValue.meaningText: Less than one night per week
validValue.description: Less than one night per week

validValue.meaningText: One or more nights per week
validValue.description: One or more nights per week

question.questionText: In the last 12 months, has wheezing ever been severe enough to limit your speech to only one or two words at a time between breaths? (wheezing_limit_speech_12_months_13)
Have you ever had asthma? (asthma_ever_13)
In the last 12 months, has your chest sounded wheezy during or after exercise? (wheezy_chest_exercise_12_months_13)
In the last 12 months, have you had a dry cough at night, apart from a cough associated with a cold or chest infection? (dry_cough_night_12_months_13)
All questions are about problems which occur when you DO NOT have a cold or the flu. (inst2_090902)
Have you ever had a problem with sneezing, or a runny or blocked nose, when you DID NOT have a cold or the flu? (sneezing_runny_nose_ever_13)
In the past 12 months, have you had a problem with sneezing, or a runny or blocked nose, when you DID NOT have a cold or the flu? (sneezing_runny_nose_12_months_13)
In the past 12 months, has this nose problem been accompanied by itchy or watery eyes? (nose_itchy_eyes_12_months_13)
In which of the past 12 months did this nose problem occur? December (sneezing_runny_nose_occurrence_months_13_december_enum)
In the past 12 months, how much did this nose problem interfere with your daily activities? (nose_interfere_activities_12_months_13)
Have you ever had hay fever? (hay_fever_ever_13)
Have you ever had an itchy rash which was coming and going for at least six months? (itchy_rash_ever_13)
Have you had this itchy rash at any time in the last 12 months? (itchy_rash_12_months_13)

Has this itchy rash at any time affected any of the following places: the folds of the elbows, behind the knees, in front of the ankles, under the buttocks, or around the neck, ears, or eyes? (itchy_rash_affected_sites_places_13)
Has this rash cleared completely at any time during the last 12 months? (itchy_rash_cleared_completely_13)
In the last 12 months, how often, on average, have you been kept awake at night by this itchy rash? (itchy_rash_often_awake_night_13)

validValue.meaningText: Less than one night per week
validValue.description: Less than one night per week

validValue.meaningText: One or more nights per week
validValue.description: One or more nights per week

question.questionText: Have you ever had eczema? (eczema_ever_13)
Has your child ever had wheezing or whistling in the chest at any time in the past? (wheezing_whistling_chest_ever_6)
Has your child had wheezing or whistling in the chest in the last 12 months? (wheezing_whistling_chest_12_months_6)

question.questionText: In the last 12 months, has wheezing ever been severe enough to limit your child's speech to only one or two words at a time between breaths? (wheezing_limit_speech_12_months_6)
Has your child ever had asthma? (asthma_ever_6)
In the last 12 months, has your child's chest sounded wheezy during or after exercise? (wheezy_chest_exercise_12_months_6)
In the last 12 months, has your child had a dry cough at night, apart from a cough associated with a cold or chest infection? (dry_cough_night_12_months_6)
Has your child ever had a problem with sneezing, or a runny or blocked nose, when he/she DID NOT have a cold or the flu? (sneezing_runny_nose_ever_6)
In the past 12 months, has your child had a problem with sneezing, or a runny or blocked nose, when he/she DID NOT have a cold or the flu? (sneezing_runny_nose_12_months_6)
In the past 12 months, has this nose problem been accompanied by itchy, watery eyes? (nose_itchy_eyes_12_months_6)
In which of the past 12 months did this nose problem occur? December (sneezing_runny_nose_occurrence_months_6_december_enum)
In the past 12 months, how much did this nose problem interfere with your child's daily activities? (nose_interfere_activities_12_months_6)
Has your child ever had hay fever? (hay_fever_ever_6)
Has your child ever had an itchy rash that was coming and going for at least 6 months? (itchy_rash_ever_6)
Has your child had this itchy rash at any time in the last 12 months? (itchy_rash_12_months_6)

Has this itchy rash at any time affected any of the following places: the folds of the elbows, behind the knees, in front of the ankles, under the buttocks, or around the neck, ears, or eyes? (itchy_rash_affected_sites_places_6)
At what age did this itchy rash first occur? (itchy_rash_first_age_6)
Has this rash cleared completely at any time during the last 12 months? (itchy_rash_cleared_completely_6)
In the last 12 months, how often, on average, has your child been kept awake at night by this itchy rash? (itchy_rash_often_awake_night_6)

validValue.meaningText: Less than one night per week
validValue.description: Less than one night per week

validValue.meaningText: One or more nights per week
validValue.description: One or more nights per week

question.questionText: Has your child ever had eczema? (eczema_ever_6)

protocol.longName: Personal and Family History of Respiratory Symptoms/Diseases - Child Protocol
protocol.preferredDefinition: Age-specific questions are asked in this protocol to two different age ranges of children. For children ages 13 and 14, a set of questions is asked directly to the child. For children 6 or 7 years old, a set of questions is asked of the parents.

form.preferredDefinition: Exercise testing for evaluation of hypoxemia and/or desaturation

Medication Dose 1 (medication1_dose)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Exercise testing for evaluation of hypoxemia and/or desaturation

form.preferredDefinition: A trained technician places a sensor on a thin part of the patient's body, usually a fingertip or earlobe, to monitor the oxygenation of the patient's hemoglobin.

question.questionText: Saturation of oxyhemoglobin (SpO2) (pxt91101_spo2)
Arterial oxyhemoglobin saturation (SaO2) (spa2)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A trained technician places a sensor on a thin part of the patient's body, usually a fingertip or earlobe, to monitor the oxygenation of the patient's hemoglobin.

form.longName: PhenX PX091301 - Quality Of Life As Affected By Respiratory Disease
form.preferredDefinition: Self-administered questionnaire contains 50 items and 76 weighted responses divided into three components: Symptoms (frequency and severity); Activity (activities that cause or are limited by breathlessness); and Impacts (social unctioning, psychological disturbances resulting from airways disease). The protocol is designed to measure health impairment in patients with asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It is also valid for use in bronchiectasis and has been used successfully in patients with kyphoscoliosis and sarcoidosis.

module.longName: Quality of Life as Affected by Respiratory Disease
module.preferredDefinition: Quality of Life as Affected by Respiratory Disease

question.questionText: Questions about how much chest trouble you have had over the past 3 months. (Please tick/check one.) How do you describe your current health? (health_self_assessment)
Over the past 3 months, I have coughed: (frequency_3_months_cough)
Over the past 3 months, I have brought up phlegm (sputum): (frequency_3_months_phlegm_sputum)
Over the past 3 months, I have had shortness of breath: (frequency_3_months_breath_shortness)
Over the past 3 months, I have had attacks of wheezing: (frequency_3_months_wheezing)
During the past 3 months, how many severe or very unpleasant attacks of chest trouble have you had? (three_months_chest_attack_times)
How long did the worst attack of chest trouble last? (worst_chest_attack_last)
Over the past 3 months, in an average week, how many good days (with little chest trouble) have you had? (good_days_in_week)
If you have a wheeze, is it worse in the morning? (wheeze_worse_in_morning)
How would you describe your chest condition? (chest_self_assessment)

validValue.meaningText: The most important problem I have
validValue.description: The most important problem I have

validValue.meaningText: Causes me quite a lot of problems
validValue.description: Causes me quite a lot of problems

question.questionText: If you have ever had paid employment. (chest_trouble_affect_employment)

validValue.meaningText: My chest trouble made me stop work altogether
validValue.description: My chest trouble made me stop work altogether

validValue.meaningText: My chest trouble interferes with my work or made me change my work
validValue.description: My chest trouble interferes with my work or made me change my work

validValue.meaningText: My chest trouble does not affect my work
validValue.description: My chest trouble does not affect my work

question.questionText: What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Sitting or lying still: (breathless_these_days_sitting)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Getting washed or dressed: (breathless_these_days_washed)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Walking around the home: (breathless_these_days_walking_home)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Walking outside on the level: (breathless_these_days_walking_outside)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Walking up a flight of stairs: (breathless_these_days_wakling_stairs)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Walking up hills: (breathless_these_days_walking_hills)
What activities usually make you feel breathless these days? Playing sports or games: (breathless_these_days_sports)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. My cough hurts: (cough_breathless_hurts)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. My cough makes me tired: (cough_breathless_tired)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. I am breathless when I talk: (cough_breathless_when_talk)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. I am breathless when I bend over: (cough_breathless_when_bend_over)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. My cough or breathing disturbs my sleep: (cough_breathless_disturb_sleep)
Some more questions about your cough and breathlessness these days. I get exhausted easily: (cough_breathless_exhausted)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. My cough or breathing is embarrassing in public: (chest_effect_embarrassing_public)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. My chest trouble is a nuisance to my family, friends, or neighbors: (chest_effect_nuisance_family_friend)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. I get afraid or panic when I cannot get my breath: (chest_effect_afraid_panic)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. I feel that I am not in control of my chest problem: (chest_effect_not_in_control)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. I do not expect my chest to get any better: (chest_effect_not_get_better)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. I have become frail or an invalid because of my chest: (chest_effect_frail_invalid)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. Exercise is not safe for me: (chest_effect_exercise_not_safe)
Questions about other effects that your chest trouble may have on you these days. Everything seems too much of an effort: (chest_effect_everything_much_effort)
Questions about your medication these days. Are you currently taking medication? (medication_these_days_taking)
Questions about your medication these days. My medication does not help me very much: (medication_not_help)
Questions about your medication these days. I get embarrassed using my medication in public: (medication_embarrassed_using_public)
Questions about your medication these days. I have unpleasant side effects from my medication: (medication_unpleasant_side_effects)
Questions about your medication these days. My medication interferes with my life a lot: (medication_interfere_life)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. I take a long time to get washed or dressed: (activities_affected_washed_dressed)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. I cannot take a bath or shower, or I take a long time: (activities_affected_bath_shower)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. I walk slower than other people, or I stop for rests: (activities_affected_walk_stop)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. Jobs such as housework take a long time, or I have to stop for rests: (activities_affected_housework_stop)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. If I walk up one flight of stairs, I have to go slowly or stop: (activities_affected_upstairs_stop)
Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. If I hurry or walk fast, I have to stop or slow down: (activities_affected_hurry_fast_stop)

Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. My breathing makes it difficult to do things such as walk up hills, carrying things up stairs, light gardening such as weeding, dance, play bowls, or play golf: (breathing_difficult_activities_light)
My breathing makes it difficult to do things such as carry heavy loads, dig the garden or shovel snow, jog or walk at 5 miles per hour, play tennis or swim. (breathing_difficult_activities_heavy)

Questions about how your activities might be affected by your breathing. My breathing makes it difficult to do things such as very heavy manual work, run, cycle, swim fast, or play competitive sports: (breathing_difficult_activities_very_heavy)
We would like to know how your chest usually affects your daily life. I cannot play sports or games: (daily_life_sports_games)
We would like to know how your chest usually affects your daily life. I cannot go out for entertainment or recreation: (daily_life_entertainment_recreation)
We would like to know how your chest usually affects your daily life. I cannot go out of the house to do the shopping: (daily_life_go_out_shopping)
We would like to know how your chest usually affects your daily life. I cannot do housework: (daily_life_housework)
We would like to know how your chest usually affects your daily life. I cannot move far from my bed or chair: (daily_life_far_bed_chair)

Please write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing. Here is a list of other activities that your chest trouble may prevent you doing. (You do not have to tick these they are just to remind you of ways in which your breathlessness may affect you): Going for walks or walking the dogDoing things at home or in the gardenSexual intercourseGoing out to church, pub, club, or place of entertainmentGoing out in bad weather or into smoky roomsVisiting family or friends or playing with childrenPlease write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing: (daily_life_specify_1)

Please write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing. Here is a list of other activities that your chest trouble may prevent you doing. (You do not have to tick these they are just to remind you of ways in which your breathlessness may affect you): Going for walks or walking the dogDoing things at home or in the gardenSexual intercourseGoing out to church, pub, club, or place of entertainmentGoing out in bad weather or into smoky roomsVisiting family or friends or playing with childrenPlease write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing: (daily_life_specify_2)

Please write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing. Here is a list of other activities that your chest trouble may prevent you doing. (You do not have to tick these they are just to remind you of ways in which your breathlessness may affect you): Going for walks or walking the dogDoing things at home or in the gardenSexual intercourseGoing out to church, pub, club, or place of entertainmentGoing out in bad weather or into smoky roomsVisiting family or friends or playing with childrenPlease write in any other important activities that your chest trouble may stop you doing: (daily_life_specify_3)
Which you think best describes how your chest affects you? (chest_affect_best_description)

protocol.longName: Quality of Life as Affected by Respiratory Disease
protocol.preferredDefinition: Self-administered questionnaire contains 50 items and 76 weighted responses divided into three components: Symptoms (frequency and severity); Activity (activities that cause or are limited by breathlessness); and Impacts (social unctioning, psychological disturbances resulting from airways disease). The protocol is designed to measure health impairment in patients with asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It is also valid for use in bronchiectasis and has been used successfully in patients with kyphoscoliosis and sarcoidosis.

form.longName: PhenX PX090701 - Immunoglobulin E Total And Specific
form.preferredDefinition: Blood collection and bioassay for ascertaining levels of Immunoglobulin E

headerInstruction.text: Draw 24 cc of blood into one 5 ml SST gold top Vacutainer tube for IgE. The tube should be allowed to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to clot. The sample should then be spun at 2,000 rpm (room temperature: 2024oC) for 10 minutes to ..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Concentration of Immunoglobulin E (ige_concentration)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Blood collection and bioassay for ascertaining levels of Immunoglobulin E

form.longName: PhenX PX090801 - Peak Expiratory Flow Rate Pefr
form.preferredDefinition: A patient is instructed to inhale deeply and blow into a peak expiratory flow monitor three times. Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR) can be measured as part of spirometry testing (see Spirometry measure) or as a separate measurement. The highest PEFR value is typically used for analysis.

headerInstruction.text: The largest value from at least three acceptable blows is recorded.

question.questionText: Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 1 (peak_expiratory_flow_rate1)
Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 1 units (peak_expiratory_flow_rate1_units)
Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 2 (peak_expiratory_flow_rate2)
Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 2 units (peak_expiratory_flow_rate2_units)
Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 3 (peak_expiratory_flow_rate3)
Peak Expiratory Flow Rate 3 units (peak_expiratory_flow_rate3_units)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A patient is instructed to inhale deeply and blow into a peak expiratory flow monitor three times. Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR) can be measured as part of spirometry testing (see Spirometry measure) or as a separate measurement. The highest PEFR value is typically used for analysis.
